Class Voter

java.lang.Object
model.Voter
public class Voter extends Object
Represents a voter in the e-voting system.

This class is responsible for:

  • Generating cryptographic key pairs for voter authentication
  • Obtaining certificates from the Registration Authority
  • Authenticating with the Voting Server
  • Encrypting and casting votes to the Ballot Box
  • Managing certificate information

The Voter class implements retry logic for both registration and voting operations to handle transient failures.

  • Constructor Details

    • Voter

      public Voter(String id) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
      Constructs a new Voter with the specified ID.

      This constructor generates an RSA key pair for the voter to use in the registration and voting processes.

      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier for this voter.
      Throws:
      NoSuchAlgorithmException - If the RSA algorithm is unavailable.

  • Method Details

    • registerWithRA

      public void registerWithRA(RegistrationAuthority ra) throws org.bouncycastle.operator.OperatorCreationException, CertificateException
      Registers the voter with the Registration Authority to obtain a certificate.

      This method implements retry logic to handle transient failures. After successful registration, the certificate is encoded in PEM format and exported to a local file.

      Parameters:
      ra - The Registration Authority to register with.
      Throws:
      org.bouncycastle.operator.OperatorCreationException - If there is an error creating the certificate.
      CertificateException - If there is a problem with the certificate.
      SecurityException - If registration fails due to a security issue.

    • vote

      public void vote(VotingServer votingServer, BallotBox ballotBox, String choice) throws Exception
      Casts a vote for a specific candidate.

      This method:

      1. Authenticates the voter with the Voting Server and obtains a token.
      2. Encrypts the vote using the Tallying Authority's public key.
      3. Signs a hash of the vote to ensure non-repudiation.
      4. Submits the encrypted vote to the Ballot Box.
      Implements retry logic in case of transient failures during voting.
      Parameters:
      votingServer - The Voting Server used to authenticate the voter.
      ballotBox - The Ballot Box to which the vote is submitted.
      choice - The candidate selected by the voter.
      Throws:
      AuthenticationException - If authentication with the Voting Server fails.
      VoteSubmissionException - If vote submission fails after retries.
      IllegalStateException - If the voter is not registered or AA public key is not set.
      Exception

    • getCertificateSerialNumber

      public String getCertificateSerialNumber()
      Retrieves the serial number of the voter's certificate.
      Returns:
      The certificate serial number as a string.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the certificate has not been issued yet.

    • exportCertificateToFile

      public void exportCertificateToFile(String filePath) throws IOException
      Exports the voter's PEM-encoded certificate to the specified file path.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The file path where the PEM certificate should be saved.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while writing the file.
      IllegalStateException - If the PEM certificate is not available.

    • setAaPublicKey

      public void setAaPublicKey(PublicKey aaPublicKey)
      Sets the Tallying Authority's public key, used for encrypting votes.
      Parameters:
      aaPublicKey - The public key of the Tallying Authority.
